clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Camel Milk on Insulin and Incretin Response
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Camel Milk on Insulin and Incretin Response to a Mixed-meal Challenge in People With Normal Glucose Tolerance

brief_summary.textblock: To examine the differential effect of camel and cow milk on the physiological response, to a liquid mixed-meal challenge, in people with normal glucose tolerance

detailed_description.textblock: Camel milk is used as a traditional remedy throughout the Middle East and Indian Subcontinent for conditions such as type 2 diabetes and dyslipidemia. It is currently unclear how such an effect could be mediated in vivo and studies are limited. We performed this study as a pilot experiment to assess the effects of camel milk on Insulin, Glucose, GLP-1, C-peptide and Lipid profile.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose response to camel and cow milk
primary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of peak of glucose

primary_outcome.measure: Response of glucose to camel and cow milk
primary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of area under the curve

secondary_outcome.measure: Insulin response to camel and cow milk
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of peak

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of insulin to camel and cow milk
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of area under the curve

secondary_outcome.measure: GLP-1 response to camel and cow milk
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of peak

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of GLP-1 to camel and cow milk
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of area under the curve

secondary_outcome.measure: C-peptide response to camel and cow milk
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of peak

secondary_outcome.measure: Response of C-peptide to camel and cow milk
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between interventions in terms of area under the curve

intervention.description: Camel Milk administered 10 minutes before a mixed meal of carbohydrate and protein; 2-week washout between interventions
Cow milk administered 10 minutes before a mixed meal of carbohydrate and protein;2-week washout between interventions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal glucose tolerance
- BMI < 30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Impaired fasting glucose or impaired glucose tolerance
- Lactose intolerance
- Weight loss / gain â‰¥ 5 kg in the preceding two months
- Use of estrogenic drugs or corticosteroids
- Known hypertriglyceridemia requiring treatment
- History of heart attack, angina or cardiovascular disorder
- History of malignant tumor
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Hemoglobin < 12 for any reason
- Recent surgery or major hemorrhage
- History of bariatric or metabolic surgery

overall_official.last_name: Dr Nader Lessan, MBBS MD FRCP
